brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this preliminary study is to compare the effects of a program that includes
      either one-month or two-months of structured lab-based training. The proposed study will
      examine the effects of a lifestyle physical activity intervention designed to increase PA in
      people with moderate and severe COPD. The intervention includes a combination of (a)
      structured laboratory-based exercises with a behavioral intervention, (b) structured
      home-based exercises and (c) lifestyle physical activities performed at home. The subjects
      will be followed for a total of 18 weeks.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lifestyle Physical Activity for People With COPD

detailed_description.textblock:
People with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) experience a gradual decline in
      physical activity (PA). Exercise training in a structured pulmonary rehabilitation program
      can generate substantial gains in functional capacity, but increases in functional capacity
      do not necessarily lead to improvements in daily PA. The proposed study will examine the
      effects of a lifestyle physical activity intervention designed to increase PA in people with
      moderate and severe COPD. The intervention includes a combination of (a) structured
      laboratory-based exercises with a self-efficacy enhancing intervention, (b) structured
      home-based exercises and (c) lifestyle physical activities performed at home. The
      intervention gradually transitions subjects from the structured laboratory-based exercises
      that focus on walking and circuit training to fully integrated lifestyle physical activities
      that integrate structured home-based exercises and lifestyle physical activities into daily
      life. Ideally the laboratory-based component would be as short as possible to facilitate the
      application of this intervention in the clinical setting. The purpose of this preliminary
      study is to compare the effects of a program that includes either one-month or two-months of
      structured lab-based training and subjects will be followed for a total of 18 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  55 years or older

          -  Moderate to severe COPD (FEV1 < 80% and > 30% predicted; FEV1/FVC <70%) as the
             primary health problem

          -  Sedentary (less than 30 minutes of moderate activity 3 days/week)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  No acute exacerbations or major illnesses requiring hospitalization in the last 8
             weeks.

          -  No history of other major lung diseases as primary pulmonary problem, history of a
             recent heart attack or recent onset of chest pains with activity or increasing
             episodes of chest pain (unstable angina).

          -  No other health problems or mobility problems that limit physical activity.

          -  No child bearing potential

intervention.description: Subjects will come into an exercise lab 2 days per week and perform 10-20 minutes of walking, 13 strength training exercises, stretching and a behavioral intervention including goal setting, etc.

primary_outcome.description: Subjects wear two activity monitors for seven consecutive days (Actipal and Actigraph). The study will compare the subject's activity level at the three time points listed.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity measured by accelerometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: During initial visit (week 1), at 6 or 10 weeks (depending on group placement), and at week 18

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Subjects complete a 6 minute walk test measuring the total distance he/she can walk in 6 minutes at the three time points listed.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During initial visit (week 1), at 6 or 10 weeks (depending on group placement), and at week 18

secondary_outcome.description: Subjects complete a performance test measuring balance, gait speed, and leg strength (using a chair stand test) at the three time points listed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in lower extremity function (Short Physical Performance Battery)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During initial visit (week 1), at 6 or 10 weeks (depending on group placement), and at week 18

secondary_outcome.description: Subjects complete a questionnaire answering questions about their level of dyspnea in various daily activities at the three time points listed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in dyspnea and fatigue (Pulmonary Functional Status and Dyspnea Questionnaire-Modified)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During initial visit (week 1), at 6 or 10 weeks (depending on group placement), and at week 18

secondary_outcome.description: Subjects fill out a questionnaire of their perceived physical activity at the three time points listed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity measured by CHAMPS questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During initial visit (week 1), at 6 or 10 weeks (depending on group placement), and at week 18
